thread.title: Dotan Negrin quits 9 to 5 job to travel the world with dog, Brando and his PIANO
thread.title_full: Dotan Negrin quits 9 to 5 job to travel the world with dog, Brando and his PIANO | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Dotan Negrin quits 9 to 5 job to travel the world with dog, Brando and his PIANO
text:
8 shares 8
View
comments
If you thought carrying a backpack was hard enough while travelling, try transporting a piano.
Aspiring actor Dotan Negrin was not afraid of a challenge. He decided to sell all his possessions, buy a truck and set out around the world with the only two essentials he needed - his adorable dog, Brando, and a 500-pound upright piano.
Five years later and the adventurous duo have visited over 300 cities in 21 countries, sharing his love of music with people from the US, Mexico, Canada and Europe.
Aspiring actor Dotan Negrin decided to sell all his possessions, buy a truck and set out around the world with the only two essentials he needed - his adorable dog, Brando, and a 500-pound upright piano
Five years later, the adventurous duo have visited over 300 cities in 21 countries, sharing his love of music with people from the US, Mexico, Canada and Europe
The journey began back in 2010, when New-York based Negrin quit his day job and took to the road in pursuit of a new life.
With a truck he bought on eBay able to transport his piano, him and Brando - he was ready to share his passion for music with whoever would listen.
During his five-year adventure, which included driving from New York to Central America and back in seven months in 2013, the musical explorer estimates he has so far met and interacted with 10,000 individuals.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 2 Next King of the jungle is BACK! Lions are reintroduced into the... Mayhem for thousands of tourists as flights in and out of... British Airways set to take over Aer Lingus after Ryanair... 'I literally put together everything I loved about life: travel, making music and performing, and meeting people,' Negrin told Mashable .
'Dont get me wrong, this was by no means an easy life. Moving a piano is really really hard... I once had a piano fall on my hand and broke 2 fingers.'
The journey began back in 2010, when New-York based Negrin quit his fulfilling day job and took to the road in pursuit of a new life
From hopping from one job to another after college, Negrin has now ticked off many bucket list ventures.
These have included playing overlooking the breathtaking Grand Canyon and iconic Eiffel Tower.
Negrin advises to talk to local individuals upon reaching a new destination and to not have a concrete plan in mind.
His laid-back approach has helped him to discover the paths-not-so-trodden and even towns that people would not normally think to visit.
Negrin's adventures can be followed on his website, pianoaroundtheworld.com and on his Instagram .
His laid-back approach has helped him to discover places and small towns not usually explored by tourists
Negrin has played overlooking beautiful sights such as the spectacular Lake Tahoe in California
With his eBay truck able to transport his piano, him and Brando - he was ready to share his passion for music with whoever would listen
During his five-year adventure, which include driving from NYC to Central America and back in seven months in 2013, the musical explorer estimates he has so far met and interacted with 10,000 individuals
Negrin has relied on the kindness of strangers to help realise his dream, something offering a place to stay or donating money
Negrin advises to talk to local individuals upon reaching a new destination and to not have a concrete plan in mind
Negrin had to push the piano one mile every day to play piano in Union Square dodging many obstacles including cab drivers
Negrin transports his piano in a van, which he purchased on eBay after selling all of his possessions for his trip
Negrin said that he's spent a lot of time behind the wheel, driving long distances, sleeping in the back of his van, and playing piano everywhere to fund it all
Negrin visited Saratoga Springs for a weekend stay, where he played the piano and met a lot of receptive people, with dog Brando
The musician says that the road hasn't been easy and recently he has been looking for a little bit more stability in his life
Negrin's adventures can be followed on his website, pianoaroundtheworld.com and on his Instagram
